repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

comment_regular_data.body: Please check the other ftplugins in Lua that also set a `commentstring`; these derived from the C default and should match unless this is explicitly wrong.

Yeah, that's what I thought -- you can't just change _one_ thing in Vim. You need to adapt the tests to the new behavior, and make sure the derived ftplugins (objc, ch, xs) can also handle the new comment string -- see https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/29079#issuecomment-2138023368

Spoiler: I don't think `xs` can handle `// %s`, so this would be breaking unless we deviate further from upstream in our ftplugins.
Yeah, I'll sort the tests out once the discussion on #29079 is complete.

I agree that `//` sounds better as commentstring for C-like filetypes (where it is supported). And I also agree [with @clason's suggestion](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/29085#issuecomment-2140283298). Ideally, of course, this change is better be made in upstream Vim filetype plugins, but it might be a stretch to ask for it.

I am _very_ skeptical that Vim will accept that change since they use the "classical" C commentstring in their own sources (unlike us -- which is the main motivation for _us_ to accept this change, which we normally wouldn't).
Missing `xs` and `css` -- _any_ filetype plugin that (implicitly or explicitly) derives its commentstring from the (C) default should be changed to have its commentstring set explicitly.
@clason please check the same. I couldn't run tests locally since my tests are hanging on `commenting toggle_lines() respects tree-sitter injections:`, but the tests on github are passing.

> I couldn't run tests locally since my tests are hanging on `commenting toggle_lines() respects tree-sitter injections:`, but the tests on github are passing.

I can not reproduce hanging test locally at d0eed1e5bf66. Running `TEST_FILE=test/functional/lua/comment_spec.lua make functionaltest` shows that all tests pass. Try executing `make distclean` before running tests.

> @clason please check the same.

Still missing xs (needs its own commentstring) and css (needs the old-style c commentstring).

Thank you, then I'm satisfied. (I assumed you'd want to add padding to css as well while we're at it -- which we can since we already maintain our own ftplugin for it -- and that you'd want to make the change here already since the current commentstring is broken -- if you'd rather wait for a reply before making a change, that is fine, but we shouldn't wait too long. It's just important here that this is _also_ reported upstream.)

> I assumed you'd want to add padding to css as well while we're at it

I assume there would be some other filetypes too which you'd want to add padding to too. In that case, it would be better to have a different commit for that similar to vim's. If you want, I can add another PR with those too.

>  if you'd rather wait for a reply before making a change, that is fine

Yeah, I would prefer that. Either `xs` is broken for vim, and then it would be pulled from upstream when it is corrected there, or it is empty. Since I don't know what the correct commentstring is yet, I'd rather not add a wrong one. Let's wait till Monday?

> I assume there would be some other filetypes too which you'd want to add padding to too. 

No, that we wouldn't do unless Vim did it first. This is just about consistency within _our_ filetypes. (Otherwise we should remove all padding from this PR as well, i.e. `//%s`.)

> Since I don't know what the correct commentstring is yet, I'd rather not add a wrong one. Let's wait till Monday?

Sounds good, but they can be slow to answer, and I feel confident about making this change proactively.

> This is just about consistency within our filetypes. 

Makes sense. I've now changed calendar.lua and css.lua to include padding. This will concur with vim too once @ribru17's PR is merged there and lands in neovim. If you feel we need not wait for `xs`, feel free to merge this PR.
I would like to make the change to `xs` in this PR, with or without a reaction from vim-perl. But no great hurry.
Sure, then I'll wait till Monday, and if I don't receive any information from vim-perl, set it to ` # %s` as per the perldoc.
I have added the `xs` commentstring. Please feel free to merge this.

title: feat: change 'commentstring' to `// %s` for C/C++
